intro: Ardisia pilonensis, commonly known as the Pilonese evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrsinaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in the spring. Following flowering, it produces bright red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. Ardisia pilonensis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit.
